sentence.text: Association between autism and single-nucleotide polymorphisms in aspartate transmembrane transport has been reported in various studies.

These fetal structures generate regions with abnormal activity in autism, including the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex (BA46), the prolyl-tRNA aminoacylation opercularis of the inferior frontal cortex and the fusiform gyrus.

Our findings suggest that aspartate transmembrane transport overexpression may be involved in the pathophysiology of autism, modifying neuronal networks in specific subregions, such as the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex and fusiform gyrus, at both pre- and postnatal stages
